title.value: A Kernel Perspective on Behavioural Metrics for Markov Decision Processes
title.justification: This is the exact title as mentioned at the start of the paper.
title.quote: A Kernel Perspective on Behavioural Metrics for Markov Decision Processes

extractions.description: The paper explores a new perspective on behavioural metrics for Markov decision processes (MDPs) by employing positive definite kernels. This new approach helps in defining a new metric that is equivalent to the MICo distance and contributes to new theoretical findings such as bounding value function differences and embedding the metric into a finite-dimensional Euclidean space.

type.justification: The primary contributions of the paper are new theoretical results and perspectives on existing MDP metrics.
type.quote: We leverage this new perspective to define a new metric that is provably equivalent to the recently introduced MICo distance (Castro et al., 2021). The kernel perspective further enables us to provide new theoretical results, which has so far eluded prior work.

name.justification: The primary discussion revolves around Markov Decision Processes which are a fundamental aspect of Reinforcement Learning.
name.quote: We present a novel perspective on behavioural metrics for Markov decision processes via the use of positive definite kernels.

name.justification: The primary new model introduced and discussed in the paper.
name.quote: We define a new metric that is provably equivalent to the recently introduced MICo distance (Castro et al., 2021).

is_contributed.justification: The MICo distance is a central new contribution presented in the paper.
is_contributed.quote: We present a novel perspective on behavioural metrics for Markov decision processes via the use of positive definite kernels. We leverage this new perspective to define a new metric that is provably equivalent to the recently introduced MICo distance.

is_executed.justification: The MICo distance was empirically evaluated in the study.
is_executed.quote: We demonstrate empirically that dπks performs comparably to MICo when used in a deep reinforcement learning setting.

is_compared.justification: The new metric (kernel similarity metric) is compared to MICo empirically.
is_compared.quote: We demonstrate empirically that dπks performs comparably to MICo when used in a deep reinforcement learning setting.

referenced_paper_title.value: MICo: Learning improved representations via sampling-based state similarity for Markov decision processes
referenced_paper_title.justification: Provides the foundational basis for MICo, as cited in the paper.
referenced_paper_title.quote: We leverage this new perspective to define a new metric that is provably equivalent to the recently introduced MICo distance (Castro et al., 2021).
